alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 10:37PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND FOR GULF COAST AND ICY STRAIT CORRIDOR... An atmospheric river has been giving moderate to heavy rain to parts of the northern half of Southeast Alaska. Heavy rain started late Wednesday night near Yakutat, and is expected to slide over the Icy Strait corridor and central gulf coast on Friday. So far, the Yakutat airport has received well over 2 inches of rain and the Situk River has been rising rapidly from the heavy rain. This heavier rain is expected to last through Saturday morning before diminishing Saturday afternoon. Through Saturday, around 5 to 8 inches of rainfall is expected over the Northeast Gulf Coast, including Yakutat. While rain rates are expected to decrease Friday, moderate to heavy rain will return Friday night into Saturday. The northern inner channels, including the Icy Strait corridor, will see somewhat lesser amounts ranging from 2 to 5 inches of rainfall, with the highest amounts from Cross Sound to Juneau. There are some uncertainties in the total rainfall forecast as terrain could cause some local areas to get more or less total rainfall. Local rivers and streams are expected to rise as a result of this rainfall. At this time, flood potential is low, but rivers may reach, or get near, bankfull conditions. People who recreate along rivers and streams across the northern panhandle should remain alert. For any updated information on this evolving event visit weather.gov/juneau.
